title: fix: store sections before tasks
body:
## Summary

Some users mentioned syncing issues, where the sidebar would list their projects and labels, but no tasks were available. This PR tries to fix the issue that I traced to be because we synced sections after tasks (making an invalid FK error when storing tasks, resulting in storing no tasks in db).


## Changes
- [x] Code changes
- [ ] Tests added/updated
- [ ] Docs updated (README/CHANGELOG)

## Checklist
- [x] `cargo fmt` passes
- [x] `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` passes
- [x] `cargo test` passes

## Screenshots / Logs (if UI/behavioral change)

## Related issues
Fixes #127

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Refactor**
  * Removed color support for projects and labels: colors are no longer stored, shown, or synchronized during create/update flows.
  * Color-selection and propagation to external services are disabled; new/updated items omit color.

body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 5 to 6.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v6.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update README to include Node.js 24 support details and requirements by @​salmanmkc in actions/checkout#2248
  • Persist creds to a separate file by @​ericsciple in actions/checkout#2286
  • v6-beta by @​ericsciple in actions/checkout#2298
  • update readme/changelog for v6 by @​ericsciple in actions/checkout#2311

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0

v6-beta

What's Changed

Updated persist-credentials to store the credentials under $RUNNER_TEMP instead of directly in the local git config.

This requires a minimum Actions Runner version of v2.329.0 to access the persisted credentials for Docker container action scenarios.

body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.47.1 to 1.48.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.48.0

1.48.0 (October 14th, 2025)

The MSRV is increased to 1.71.

Added

  • fs: add File::max_buf_size (#7594)
  • io: export Chain of AsyncReadExt::chain (#7599)
  • net: add SocketAddr::as_abstract_name (#7491)
  • net: add TcpStream::quickack and TcpStream::set_quickack (#7490)
  • net: implement AsRef<Self> for TcpStream and UnixStream (#7573)
  • task: add LocalKey::try_get (#7666)
  • task: implement Ord for task::Id (#7530)

Changed

  • deps: bump windows-sys to version 0.61 (#7645)
  • fs: preserve max_buf_size when cloning a File (#7593)
  • macros: suppress clippy::unwrap_in_result in #[tokio::main] (#7651)
  • net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • process: upgrade Command::spawn_with to use FnOnce (#7511)
  • sync: remove inner mutex in SetOnce (#7554)
  • sync: use UnsafeCell::get_mut in Mutex::get_mut and RwLock::get_mut (#7569)
  • time: reduce the generated code size of Timeout<T>::poll (#7535)

Fixed

  • macros: fix hygiene issue in join! and try_join! (#7638)
  • net: fix copy/paste errors in udp peek methods (#7604)
  • process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • runtime: use release ordering in wake_by_ref() even if already woken (#7622)
  • sync: close the broadcast::Sender in broadcast::Sender::new() (#7629)
  • sync: fix implementation of unused RwLock::try_* methods (#7587)

Unstable

  • tokio: use cargo features instead of --cfg flags for taskdump and io_uring (#7655, #7621)
  • fs: support io_uring in fs::write (#7567)
  • fs: support io_uring with File::open() (#7617)
  • fs: support io_uring with OpenOptions (#7321)
  • macros: add local runtime flavor (#7375, #7597)

Documented

  • io: clarify the zero capacity case of AsyncRead::poll_read (#7580)
  • io: fix typos in the docs of AsyncFd readiness guards (#7583)
  • net: clarify socket gets closed on drop (#7526)
  • net: clarify the behavior of UCred::pid() on Cygwin (#7611)
  • net: clarify the supported platform of set_reuseport() and reuseport() (#7628)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 556820f chore: prepare Tokio v1.48.0 (#7677)
  • fd1659a chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.6.0 (#7676)
  • 53e8aca ci: update nightly version to 2025-10-12 (#7670)
  • 9e5527d process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • 25a24de net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • c1fa25f task: clarify the behavior of several spawn_local methods (#7669)
  • e7e02fc fs: use FileOptions inside fs::File to support uring (#7617)
  • f7a7f62 ci: remove cargo-deny Unicode-DFS-2016 license exception config (#7619)
  • d1f1499 tokio: use cargo feature for taskdump support instead of cfg (#7655)
  • ad6f618 runtime: clarify the behavior of Handle::block_on (#7665)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Enhance/backend registry
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Manage multiple integrations/backends: add, update, enable/disable, and remove.
  - Select a specific backend for synchronization.
  - Initial Todoist integration via token-based connection.

- Improvements
  - Sync now targets the chosen backend, improving data isolation and reliability.
  - More robust error handling during backend loading and usage.

- Documentation
  - Updated examples to demonstrate setting up a backend registry and selecting a backend for Sync.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Refactor/foldable sidebar items
body:
To accomodate a sidebar that will get more and more crowded with the introduction of multiple backends support, a sidebar supporting foldable items was a very welcome addition. This PR does that, and also use the same pattern we used in TasksList (one main components, that have multiple ItemsComponents)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Sidebar now supports a hierarchical view with expandable/collapsible folders and projects, plus separators and special views.
  * New item types show depth-based indentation, fold arrows, icons, and clearer selection highlighting.
* **Enhancements**
  * Reworked sidebar rendering and navigation for consistent behavior.
  * Enhanced keyboard (H/L to collapse/expand; J/K and Shift variants) and mouse interactions (click-to-select by position, smoother scrolling).
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Enhance/add backend entity
body:
Add Backend entities, since we intend to support multiple backends (multiple todoist accounts, and/or other backends like ticktick for instance)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Pluggable backend system with a built-in Todoist connector and persisted backend configurations.

- **Improvements**
  - Sync is backend-agnostic, using repository-based data access and robust mapping between remote and local items.
  - Multi-backend-ready syncing with improved conflict handling and composite keys for reliable mapping.
  - Added composite indexes for faster lookups and clearer startup timeout/error handling.

- **Chores**
  - Added async/async-trait and enhanced error-handling dependency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Fix/default project config
body:
We were setting the default project before fetching projects.
This worked for today/tomorrow/upcoming because they are always present,
but selecting actual projects was not working because we did not have
data yet.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - You can now set the UI default project by name or ID (also supports “inbox”, “today”, “tomorrow”, “upcoming”).
- Refinements
  - Smoother first-time data load: the initial sidebar selection is set after data is fetched, improving accuracy.
  - Reduced in-memory log noise when logging is disabled (less verbose output in UI log views).
- Documentation
  - Updated configuration guide and examples to reflect support for project names alongside IDs in UI settings.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Reintroduce soft deletion/completion
body:
closes #93 



<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Soft-complete and soft-delete tasks; restore tasks from completed/deleted states via UI.
- UI
  - Clear visual states: deleted (red, strikethrough), completed (gray, strikethrough), pending (normal).
  - Status icons reflect task state (deleted/completed/pending).
  - Default ordering now surfaces active tasks first, then priority and order.
- Keyboard/Interaction
  - Enter/Space: toggle complete or restore based on task state.
  - Delete: restore if already deleted; otherwise prompts confirmation.
- Refactor
  - Removed in-memory sorting; rely on persistent ordering for consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add various documentations for contributing
body: ## Summary This PR significantly enhances the project's developer experience, build reliability, and overall hygiene. It includes updates to documentation to reflect the current codebase, standardizes formatting, adds comprehensive contribution guidelines and templates, hardens the CI pipeline with MSRV pinning and OS matrix testing, enables automated dependency updates via Dependabot, and adds a `--version` flag to the CLI. ## Changes - [x] Code changes - [ ] Tests added/updated (smoke tests added to CI, but no new unit tests) - [x] Docs updated (README/CONTRIBUTING/CODE_OF_CONDUCT/PR/Issue templates) ## Checklist - [x] `cargo fmt` passes - [x] `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` passes - [x] `cargo test` passes ## Screenshots / Logs (if UI/behavioral change) N/A ## Related issues Fixes # --- ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **New Features** - Added CLI --version/-V output and updated help text. - **Documentation** - Expanded README (dependencies, project structure, dev workflow, roadmap). - Added CONTRIBUTING, CODE OF_CONDUCT, PR and issue templates, and updated product doc for Rust 1.78. - **Chores** - Repository formatting config and toolchain pinned to Rust 1.78; Cargo.lock now tracked. - CI/automation improved: multi-OS/toolchain matrix, MSRV build, caching, smoke tests, and Dependabot enabled.

title: feat: add foreign key constraints and indexes to tasks table
body:
Fixes #44

## Description

Add missing foreign key constraints and indexes to the tasks table to improve data integrity and query performance.

## Changes

- Add foreign key constraint for `project_id` with `ON DELETE CASCADE`
- Add foreign key constraint for `section_id` with `ON DELETE SET NULL`
- Add index on `project_id` for project-based task retrieval
- Add index on `section_id` for section-based task retrieval
- Add index on `parent_id` for hierarchical task queries

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Deleting a project now automatically removes its associated tasks, keeping workspaces tidy.
  * Deleting a section no longer deletes its tasks; they remain and are unassigned from that section.
  * Task navigation, filtering, and parent/child operations are faster and more responsive thanks to backend indexing improvements, especially in projects and sections with many tasks.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: fix: wrap DELETE operations in transaction for clear_all_data method
body:
Fixes #46

## Description
Wrapped all DELETE operations in the `clear_all_data` method in a single database transaction to ensure atomic deletion.

## Changes
- Added transaction wrapper using `self.pool.begin()`
- Ordered DELETE operations to respect foreign key constraints:
  1. task_labels (junction table)
  2. tasks (has self-referential FK via parent_id)
  3. sections (references projects)
  4. projects (no FKs)
  5. labels (no FKs)
- Added comments explaining the deletion order

## Benefits
- Prevents partial data deletion if an error occurs mid-operation
- Avoids potential foreign key constraint violations
- Ensures data consistency during the clear operation

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved reliability of the “Clear all data” action by making it atomic. This prevents partial deletions, avoids foreign key errors, and ensures related items are removed consistently. Users should experience fewer failures and cleaner, more predictable results when wiping or resetting data.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: Add Claude Code GitHub Workflow
body:
## 🤖 Installing Claude Code GitHub App

This PR adds a GitHub Actions workflow that enables Claude Code integration in our repository.

### What is Claude Code?

[Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code) is an AI coding agent that can help with:
- Bug fixes and improvements  
- Documentation updates
- Implementing new features
- Code reviews and suggestions
- Writing tests
- And more!

### How it works

Once this PR is merged, we'll be able to interact with Claude by mentioning @claude in a pull request or issue comment.
Once the workflow is triggered, Claude will analyze the comment and surrounding context, and execute on the request in a GitHub action.

### Important Notes

- **This workflow won't take effect until this PR is merged**
- **@claude mentions won't work until after the merge is complete**
- The workflow runs automatically whenever Claude is mentioned in PR or issue comments
- Claude gets access to the entire PR or issue context including files, diffs, and previous comments

### Security

- Our Anthropic API key is securely stored as a GitHub Actions secret
- Only users with write access to the repository can trigger the workflow
- All Claude runs are stored in the GitHub Actions run history
- Claude's default tools are limited to reading/writing files and interacting with our repo by creating comments, branches, and commits.
- We can add more allowed tools by adding them to the workflow file like:

```
allowed_tools: Bash(npm install),Bash(npm run build),Bash(npm run lint),Bash(npm run test)
```

There's more information in the [Claude Code action repo](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action).

After merging this PR, let's try mentioning @claude in a comment on any PR to get started!

title: Restore sectioning functionality and fix task dialog project selection
body:
## Summary
- Restores the sectioning functionality that was lost during the modular refactor
- Fixes task creation dialog to properly preselect and use current project
- Maintains the clean modular architecture with new TaskListItemType components

## Technical Changes
### ✅ Sectioning Restored
- **Today View**: Separates tasks into "⏰ Overdue" and "📅 Today" sections with separators
- **Tomorrow View**: Adds "📅 Tomorrow" header for all tasks
- **Upcoming View**: Groups tasks by date with formatted headers (e.g., "📊 Friday - Mar 15")  
- **Project View**: Groups tasks by project sections with proper separators
- **Label View**: Filtered hierarchical display for label-specific tasks

### ✅ Task Dialog Fixed  
- When viewing a specific project, task creation dialog now preselects that project
- User can change project selection via Tab, and submission correctly uses their choice
- Fixed submission logic to prioritize user selection over default preselection

### ✅ Code Improvements
- Created modular `TaskListItemType` enum with `Task`, `Header`, and `Separator` variants
- Implemented `ListItem` trait for consistent rendering interface
- Simplified render methods and removed redundant code
- Maintained all existing features: task descriptions, hierarchical display, etc.

## Test Plan
- [x] Compilation successful with no errors
- [x] All existing tests pass
- [x] Release build successful
- [x] Sectioning works across all view types (Today, Tomorrow, Upcoming, Project, Label)
- [x] Task dialog correctly preselects current project
- [x] Task dialog respects user's project selection changes
- [x] Hierarchical task display and descriptions preserved

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
